content: I am finding (per the note!) that the grind attribute on countP_eq_length_filter is really aggressive and often ends up extra work I don't need. In many ways I would rather we just had countP_nil and countP_cons having grind. Sometimes I can see the extra power is very useful but I do find it gets in the way a bit. Anyone else find this?
Even if we keep the grind attribute on this, I think adding it to countP_cons and countP_nil has merit.

We now have many new guard conditions available to control activations, but I haven't really started using them yet. If you have examples where you want countP_eq_length_filter and examples where you don't, please provide me with some samples on both sides, and I'm pretty confident we can pick some guard conditions that separate them fairly well.
Awesome, that sounds great. I will give it some thought.
(These were added in lean#11428, and some additional documentation in lean#11429.)

@Wrenna Robson or @Bhavik Mehta, did you have any examples where it causes too much work?

If not, we can just remove it, as in lean#11542.
Ah sorry - no I have not had time.
I think removing it would be the right choice honestly - but I expect it will break some stuff! You'll want to add countP_cons instead.
I've had examples where this appeared to be the case in the past, but I haven't kept them, sorry. It seems reasonable to me to remove it.
